snippet: The girl, Siporah Sassoon, and her mother, Gayle, were the only survivors of the March 21 fire, which began with a hot plate at their Orthodox Jewish home.
abstract: Siporah Sassoon, 15-year-old girl who was severely burned but survived March 2015 house fire in Midwood section of Brooklyn that killed her seven siblings, is released from hospital; only Siporah and her mother Gayle escaped deadly blaze caused by hot plate in family's Orthodox Jewish home; father Gabriel was away the night of fire.

byline.original: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and ANN FARMER

lead_paragraph: The girl, Siporah Sassoon, and her mother, Gayle, were the only survivors of the March 21 fire, which began with a hot plate at their Orthodox Jewish home.

headline.main: Brooklyn Girl Injured in a Fire That Killed 7 Siblings Is Said to Be Recovering
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Girl Injured in a Fire That Killed 7 Siblings Is Said to Be Recovering
